sites.name: Schönbrunn Palace
sites.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Schönbrunn Palace is a former imperial summer residence with 1,441 rooms, showcasing Baroque architecture. It features breathtaking gardens, the Gloriette, and the world's oldest zoo.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peak season in summer; winter offers beautiful Christmas markets.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online in advance, especially during peak seasons to avoid long queues. Guided tours are recommended.

sites.name: St. Stephen's Cathedral
sites.description: St. Stephen's Cathedral is a Gothic masterpiece and a symbol of Vienna, known for its colorful tiled roof and the South Tower, offering panoramic city views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busier during religious holidays; early mornings are quieter.
sites.booking_tips: Entrance is free, but guided tours and tower access require tickets. Consider visiting during a choir performance for a unique experience.

sites.name: Belvedere Palace
sites.description: The Belvedere is a Baroque palace complex housing an extensive art collection, including Gustav Klimt’s 'The Kiss'. It consists of the Upper and Lower Belvedere, surrounded by beautiful gardens.
sites.seasonal_notes: Gardens are best in spring and summer; art exhibitions are year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase a combined ticket for both Upper and Lower Belvedere. Online booking can save time.

sites.name: Hofburg Palace
sites.description: The Hofburg was the Imperial Palace of the Habsburg dynasty, now housing several museums, the Austrian National Library, and the Spanish Riding School.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; summer sees more tourists.
sites.booking_tips: Buy tickets online for specific museums or a combo ticket. Check schedules for Spanish Riding School performances.

sites.name: Prater
sites.description: Prater is a large public park in Vienna featuring the iconic Giant Ferris Wheel, known as the Wiener Riesenrad, and various amusement attractions.
sites.seasonal_notes: The amusement park is closed in winter; spring and summer are optimal.
sites.booking_tips: Admission to the park is free; rides have individual fees. Ferris wheel tickets can be bought online.

sites.name: Vienna State Opera
sites.description: One of the most prestigious opera houses globally, the Vienna State Opera offers world-class performances. Its architecture and acoustics make it a cultural icon.
sites.seasonal_notes: Opera season runs from September to June; the summer is less busy.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets months in advance for popular performances. Consider standing-room tickets for budget options.

sites.name: Vienna City Hall (Rathaus)
sites.description: A Neo-Gothic masterpiece, the Vienna City Hall hosts the city government and features the Rathausplatz, known for events like the Christmas Market and film festivals.
sites.seasonal_notes: Christmas Market in winter; summer film festival.
sites.booking_tips: Free guided tours are available on specific days; check the schedule online.

sites.name: Kunsthistorisches Museum
sites.description: The Kunsthistorisches Museum houses one of the most important art collections in the world, with works by masters like Caravaggio, Raphael, and Vermeer.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded in the early mornings, especially during weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Buy tickets online to avoid lines. Special exhibitions may require separate tickets.

sites.name: Naschmarkt
sites.description: Vienna's most famous market, the Naschmarkt offers a rich variety of food stalls and restaurants, providing a vibrant culinary experience.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open-air market; busiest on Saturdays.
sites.booking_tips: No entry fee; arrive early to avoid crowds and enjoy a leisurely experience.

sites.name: The Vienna Woods
sites.description: A scenic forested area on the outskirts of Vienna, offering hiking trails, wildlife, and serene views, perfect for nature lovers.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best in spring and autumn; trails may be muddy in winter.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Wear appropriate footwear for hiking.

sites.name: Albertina
sites.description: The Albertina is renowned for its vast collection of graphic art, including works by Monet, Picasso, and Dürer, housed in a majestic Habsburg palace.
sites.seasonal_notes: Special exhibitions can draw larger crowds.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online; consider a combo ticket if visiting multiple museums.

sites.name: Hundertwasserhaus
sites.description: A unique residential building designed by Friedensreich Hundertwasser, famous for its bold colors, uneven floors, and incorporation of nature.
sites.seasonal_notes: Visible year-round; nearby museum offers more insights.
sites.booking_tips: No entry to the building itself; view from the street and visit the nearby Kunst Haus Wien for more Hundertwasser works.

sites.name: Spanish Riding School
sites.description: The Spanish Riding School is the only institution in the world that still practices classical dressage in the tradition of the 'High School'.
sites.seasonal_notes: Performances and training sessions are less frequent in summer.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets sell out quickly, especially for performances. Consider a morning exercise session for a cheaper alternative.

sites.name: Museum of Natural History
sites.description: Home to one of the largest natural history collections in the world, featuring dinosaur skeletons, meteorites, and the famous Venus of Willendorf.
sites.seasonal_notes: Family-friendly, can be crowded on weekends and school holidays.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets available; consider visiting on weekdays for a quieter experience.

sites.name: Mariahilfer Straße
sites.description: Vienna's largest shopping street, Mariahilfer Straße offers an extensive selection of shops, boutiques, and cafes, attracting both locals and tourists.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busy during sales periods and holidays.
sites.booking_tips: No entry fee; best visited during weekdays to avoid crowds.

sites.name: Sigmund Freud Museum
sites.description: Located in Freud's former residence and workplace, the museum offers insights into the life and work of the father of psychoanalysis.
sites.seasonal_notes: Quieter during weekdays; special events may occur.
sites.booking_tips: Advance tickets recommended, especially for special exhibitions.

sites.name: Karlsplatz and Karlskirche
sites.description: Karlsplatz is a bustling square featuring Karlskirche, a Baroque church known for its impressive dome and reflecting pool.
sites.seasonal_notes: Summer concerts and winter markets enhance the experience.
sites.booking_tips: Entry to the church requires a ticket; guided tours are available.

sites.name: Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra
sites.description: Renowned worldwide, the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra performs in the Musikverein, known for its exceptional acoustics.
sites.seasonal_notes: New Year's Concert is world-famous; tickets are in high demand.
sites.booking_tips: Book as early as possible, particularly for popular performances.

sites.name: Haus der Musik
sites.description: An interactive sound museum, Haus der Musik offers a unique exploration of music through interactive exhibits and virtual conducting experiences.
sites.seasonal_notes: Family-friendly, good for rainy days.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available online; check for special events or workshops.

sites.name: Vienna Zoo
sites.description: The world's oldest zoo, located in the Schönbrunn Palace grounds, known for its conservation efforts and diverse animal exhibits.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in spring and autumn; summer can be crowded.
sites.booking_tips: Buy tickets online for faster entry, especially in peak seasons.

sites.name: Rathausplatz
sites.description: A prominent square in front of the City Hall, known for hosting events like the Christmas Market, film festivals, and the Life Ball.
sites.seasonal_notes: Events and markets vary by season; summer film festivals and winter markets are highlights.
sites.booking_tips: Entry is free, but events may require tickets. Check schedules online.
